pages.text: Level 1 Book 5. Tan Tan!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
It is Tan Tan.
Tan Tan is in pants.
An ant and Tan Tan.
Tan Tan and the ant spin.
Tan Tan tip it.
To the pit, Tan Tan!

pages.text: Level 1 Book 6. Nat!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Pip, Pat, Tan Tan and Nat.
Pat, you spin it.
Pip, you spin!
Tan Tan, you tap it!
Is that you, Pat?
It is you, Pat!
Is that you, Pip?
It is you, Pip!

options: Pip, Pat, Tan Tan and Nat
questions.answer: Pip, Pat, Tan Tan and Nat

pages.text: Level 1 Book 7. It is for you!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Is it for me, Pat?
This is for you.
Pip sits and sips.
Pat sits and he spits pips.
Is that an ant, Pip?
No, it is a nit.
Pat, Pip and a nit in the pit.
A tin for the nits.
It is a tin of nits for you.

pages.text: Level 2 Book 1. Pat’s Cap!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Pat has a red cap. He taps on it.
Pip sits by Pat. She points to the cap.
'It is a big cap,' said Pip. Pat nods.
Stan picks up the cap. He puts it on Pat’s head.
'It is for you, Pat,' said Stan. Pat grins.
Pip claps for Pat and his cap. Pat pats the cap.
Nip runs to see the cap. He sits with Pat.
Pat takes off the cap. He hands it to Nip.
'It is a nice cap,' said Pat. Nip nods.
They sit and chat by the cap. It is a fun day.

questions.question: What color is Pat’s cap?
Who points to Pat’s cap?
Who puts the cap on Pat’s head?
Who does Pat give the cap to?
What do they do at the end of the story?

pages.text: Level 2 Book 2. Nip and the Ant Nest!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Nip sat on the red sand. Ants ran near a nest.
'Can I get the nest?' said Nip. 'No, Nip, STOP!' said Pip.
Nip hit the nest with a stick. Ants ran at Nip. 'Drat!' said Nip.
Pip got a cup. Drip, drip went the water on Nip’s hand.
'Ants are pests,' said Nip. Pip said, 'Ants get nuts and seeds.
Nip sat on the sand. Ants ran back to the nest.
The sun was red at the end of the day.
Pip and Nip went to the tent.
They sat by the tent. Nip said, 'Ants are not bad.'

questions.question: Where did Nip sit?
What did Nip use to hit the nest?
What did Pip use to help Nip?
What do ants get, according to Pip?
What did Nip say at the end?

pages.text: Level 2 Book 3. Picnic with Tid!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Pip and Pat set up a picnic by the pond. They put a red rug on the sand.
A pot with snacks and mugs for drinks is on the rug. Tid, the dog, run to the rug.
Pat picks a stick from the sand. He drops it in the pond for Tid.
Pip takes nuts from a tin and set them on the rug. Tid steps into the pond to get the stick.
Tid taps the stick and get to the kids.
Tid drops the stick. Pip claps. Pat grins and taps his head.
Pat hands to Tid a snack from the pot. Tid sits by the rug with the stick.
They get to the sand by the pond. Pat and Tid stomp, Pip taps the pot as a drum.
After the fun, kids have snacks and sip drinks at the rug.
'It was the best picnic', said Pip. They stack the pot and mugs in the sack and trek to the tent.

questions.question: Where do Pip and Pat set up the picnic?
What does Pat throw into the pond for Tid?
What does Pip take from the tin?
What does Pip do when Tid brings back the stick?
What do they do at the end of the picnic?

pages.text: Level 2 Book 4. Mini dragon!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Pip and Pat step on the track with a map in hand. Pat has a sack, and Pip taps the sand with a stick.
A red rock with specks of mud sits by the track. 'What is that rock?' asks Pat.
Pip taps the rock with her stick. The rock cracks with a rip on top.
A mini dragon pops out of the cracked rock. 'Drat! It’s a dragon!' says Pip.
The dragon is damp and stomps on the sand.
It spins and sticks to Pat. 'It likes you!' says Pip.
The dragon taps Pat’s sack and inspects the snacks. 'What do we name it?' asks Pip.
'We name it Dom' says Pat. Pip sets a snack on the rock, and Dom steps to it.
Dom stomps and spins by them. Mud drips as it romps on the track.
Pip and Pat grin as they pack their sack. 'Dom, you go with us!' says Pip.

questions.question: What are Pip and Pat holding when they step on the track?
What cracks open on the track?
What comes out of the cracked rock?
What name do they give to the dragon?
What do Pip and Pat say at the end?

pages.text: Level 2 Book 5. Stan’s rocket!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Stan stands by the track with his red rocket. Pip and Pat sit on a mat.
'This rocket can go up!' says Stan. He sets it on the ramp and tips it to run.
The rocket runs but stops in the mud. 'Drat! It’s stuck!' says Stan.
Stan gets it from the mud and taps it with his hand. 'Set it again!' says Pat.
On the next set, the rocket spins on the sand. 'It is fun!' says Pip.
Stan spins the red head and set it to the ramp again.
It hits a rock and cracks. The kids run to the rocket. 'It’s cracked,' says Pip.
'We go to Nick, he can help' said Pat. They go to Nick’s desk.
Nick inspects the rocket, taps it with a stick, and grins. 'It can work again,' he says.
Stan sets the rocket on the ramp again. This time, It can go up, but it hangs in a tree.
Pip get a stick. Stan and Pat tap the tree.

questions.question: What does Stan have with him?
What happens when Stan sets the rocket the first time?
options: It gets stuck in the mud
questions.answer: It gets stuck in the mud

questions.question: What does the rocket hit and crack on?
Who helps fix the rocket?
Where does the rocket end up at the end?

pages.text: Level 2 Book 6. The test day!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Today, Pip and Pat have a test. They sit at a desk and get the test from Tom. Tick, tock. Tick, tock.
A cricket hops to Pip’s desk. It runs and stops on the test.
Pip tips it with the pen. The insect hops out of the test.
The words on the test stun Pat. He taps the desk with his pen. Tap, tap, tap. Pat’s pen drips ink on his test.
Tick, tock. Tick, tock. ’Stop the test and drop the pens’, says Tom. He taps the desk.
Pat’s neck drips when Tom pick up the tests.
Tom goes to his desk. He sits, sips his drink and pick up a red pen.
The pen is on the test. Tom grins. ’Tick, tick, tick’.
‘Pat, you got ten!’ Pat hops up. ‘Pip, you got ten!’ Pip grins. Tom drops the pen on the desk and grins. ’Ten for all!’
‘Ding, ding, ding’. ‘Go to the tram! It is 3pm’ says Pip. Pat nods and pack his sack.
Kids say goodbye to Tom and run to the tram to go home.

questions.question: Who gives Pip and Pat the test?
What lands on Pip’s desk during the test?
What happens when Pat taps the desk with his pen?
What score do Pat and Pip get?
Where do the kids go after the test?

pages.text: Level 2 Book 7. The tram trip!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Pip and Pat go to the tram stop. A tram comes to the stop.
Pip drops a can on the tram track. Pat picks it up and runs back to their stand.
The tram stops. Pip and Pat step onto the tram.
A man with a pink cap and a huge tan sack steps onto the tram. His sack gets stuck.
Pat tugs the tan sack and gets the man in. ’Nice, Pat’ says Pip as she nods.
The man sits and rests. He grins and says, 'Thank you,' to Pat.
Pat taps his pocket and gets a snack. Pip prods the red pack on the rack.
‘Sit or stand, Pat?’ asks Pip. Pat stands, and Pip gets a seat.
The ticket man steps up to them. ’Ticket?’ he asks.
The ticket man gets the tickets, checks them and nods.
The tram stops at the kids' home. Pip and Pat step out and say goodbye.

questions.question: Where are Pip and Pat going at the start?
What does Pip drop on the tram track?
What happens to the man's tan sack?
Who checks their tickets?
Where does the tram stop at the end?

pages.text: Level 2 Book 8. The trumpet!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Nip picks up a trumpet and spins it. ‘What is this? Is it a tin? Is it a can?’ Nip taps it.
Stan steps up to Nip. ‘That is not a tin. Or a can.’ Stan taps the trumpet. ’That is a trumpet, Nip.’ Nip nods.
‘Can I have the trumpet, Nip? ‘ Stan grins. Nip nods at Stan. Stan pats Nip.
Stan gets the trumpet from Nip. Stan inspects the trumpet!
‘One word, Stan! STOP!’ Nip snaps. Nip gets mad. Stan stops.
‘What a ruckus! What a din!’ Nip stomps.
Stan is sad. He drop the trumpet. ’This is what a trumpet is, Nip.’ Stan’s neck drops.
Nip is sad. Nip picks up the trumpet and inspects it. ’Stan, you must mend the crack in the trumpet.’

questions.question: What does Nip pick up at the start?
Who tells Nip it is a trumpet?
How does Nip feel when Stan plays the trumpet?
What happens after Stan stops playing?
What does Nip ask Stan to do?
options: Mend the crack in the trumpet
questions.answer: Mend the crack in the trumpet

pages.text: Level 2 Book 9. At the dump!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Dom the dragon is at the dump with Nick. ‘This is the tip, Dom.’ Nick grins.
‘Is it not the dump?’ Dom tips his neck. Nick grins. ’The tip is the dump.’
‘The dump stinks!’ Dom grins and runs to a tent with a rip. He picks up the tent. ‘A rat’s nest!’
Rats run from the nest. Dom kicks a can and gets dust on Nick’s pants and socks. ‘Dom!’
‘Is this your mat, Nick?’  Dom picks up a mat with gunk on it.
’That gunk stinks, Dom! Stop!’ Nick snaps at the dragon. Dom drops the mat and runs up a ramp.
Dom picks up one pot with a crack in it and drops it. He romps in the dust and mud.
‘Dom, get in the truck.’ Nick is mad. ‘You are not to run at the dump.’

questions.question: Who is at the dump with Nick?
What does Dom find in the tent?
What gets on Nick’s pants and socks?
What does Dom drop after Nick snaps at him?
Where does Nick tell Dom to go at the end?

pages.text: Level 2 Book 10. Cat and rat!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Pip and Pat step to the pond and spot a cat on the dock. By the sand, a rat rests in a nest.
'The cat will catch the rat,' says Pip. Pat points to the nest and says, 'The rat must run!'
The rat nips out of the nest and taps its head. Pip says, 'What can we do? The cat will get it!'
Pat claps his hands to stop the cat. The cat smacks the dust and spins with a hiss.
The rat sprints out of the nest to a rock. The cat runs after it, but skids in the mud.
'Meow!' says the cat as it gets stuck in the mud. Pip and Pat grin and point at the cat in the mud.
The rat runs to the rock and sits. Pip taps Pat and says, 'We did it!'
The cat, with suds and dust on it, stomps in the mud. Pat says, 'The cat must step into the pond!'
Pip and Pat run to the rat by the rock. The rat nods at them, as if to say thanks.
Pip and Pat step back to their tent. 'That was fun!' says Pat, and Pip nods with a grin.

questions.question: Where do Pip and Pat spot the cat?
What does Pat do to stop the cat?
Where does the rat run to escape the cat?
What happens to the cat in the mud?
How does the rat respond at the end?

storybooks.title: Van and Fox in the Box

pages.text: Level 3 Book 1. Fox!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Van and Buzz went to the hill. They had buns, jam, and a red box.
Van sat on the box in the sun next to a log. Six bugs and a big yak sat on the log.
Buzz and Van got a stick for Fox. "Run, Fox, get the stick. Can you run?"
But Fox did not get the stick. Fox ran to the bugs. He ran in the mud. He ran to the log.
"Stop, Fox! You must not run to the log!" Van got mad. "Stop, Fox! Stop!"
He was a bad fox. He was wet. He had mud on him.
Fox was sad. He sat by Van. Fox was hot. He had a big sip and a bun.
He had a nap in the sun.

questions.question: Who went to the hill with Van?
What did Van and Buzz bring to the hill?
options: Buns, jam, and a red box
questions.answer: Buns, jam, and a red box

questions.question: What did Fox do instead of getting the stick?
What did Fox have at the end?
options: A big sip and a bun
questions.answer: A big sip and a bun

pages.text: Level 3 Book 2. Tid the Pup!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
There is a pup on the mat.
This is Tid. He sits next to Jay and gets a big gulp of water.
Jay pats him and picks him up. Jay hugs Tid and rubs his back.
Up jumps the pup and zips across the mat. He stops at the box, then jumps on the bed.
There is a problem. The pup will not stop. He runs left and then right. He yelps and spins.
"Stop, Tid! Stop! Do not run there!" said Jay. But Tid did not stop.
He hops in the bin. He jumps on the red bag. Tid flings the fan and bumps the cup.
The jug falls off the box and Tid gets stuck next to the bed.
Up jumps Jay. Jay zips to Tid and grabs him. He lifts the pup and hugs him.
"No more tricks," said Jay. She pops Tid back on the mat.

questions.question: What is the name of the pup?
What does Jay do after Tid drinks water?
Where does Tid jump after stopping at the box?
What falls off the box?
What does Jay say at the end?

pages.text: Level 3 Book 3. Go on a Picnic!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Nick and Jay got in the red van. They were off on a big picnic trip.
When they got there, they set up camp by the pond. Jay got the tent and Nick got the pegs. "Let’s grab lots of sticks," said Jay.
The sun was hot. Nick went to get the zinc and a hat. "The sun is so hot," said Jay.
They ran to the pond. “Can we have a swim?” said Nick. "No," said Jay. "There are animals in the pond."
"Look," said Jay. "Six ducks, a frog, and a fat bug!"
They sat on a rug and had snacks. They had buns, jam, and cold fizz. Nick gave Max the dog a snack too.
Then Nick and Jay ran up the big hill. "We can zig zag to the top," said Jay. "We can jump across the steps," said Nick.
At the end, they went back to the van. "We had such fun!" said Nick.

questions.question: What color was the van Nick and Jay took?
Where did they set up camp?
Why didn’t they swim in the pond?
options: There were animals in the pond
questions.answer: There were animals in the pond

questions.question: What snack did they have?
What did they do at the end of the day?

pages.text: Level 3 Book 4. Which one?
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Which hat will Nan get — the red one with dots, or the pink one with a gold band?
Which can Nat pick — the red golf bag or the black bat next to the bed?
Which is for Max — the top that spins or the six sticks on the deck?
Which drink will Nan have — hot milk in the mug or pink fizz in the cup?
Which dress will Nat get — the red one with a black belt or the gold one with a jacket?
Which toy can Nan grab — the red rocket in the box or the black truck with words on it?
Which snack will Nat pick — jam buns on the mat or hot buns in the bag?
Which will you pick — the gold locket, red sled, or jazz trumpet from the band?

questions.question: What color is the hat with a gold band that Nan might get?
What is next to the bed for Nat to choose?
What is for Max in the story?
Which drink is in the cup?
What are the three things listed at the end to choose from?

pages.text: Level 3 Book 5. What Can You Do?
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
What can you do? Can you hop, skip, and flip? Can you ride, spin, and jump? Can you do your best tricks?
What can Rex do? "I can box, jog, and do laps," said Rex with a grin. "That is top stuff!" they all said.
What can Meg do? "I can skip, twirl, and kick a ball into the net!" said Meg. "That is magic!" they all said.
What can Pop do? "I can dab, clap, tap, and twist," said Pop with a bop. "That is gold!" they all said.
What can Gus do? "I can hike, leap, hum, and juggle cups," said Gus with a wiggle. "That is tops!" they all said.
What can Liz do? "I can ride my scooter, zip fast, and spin on one foot!" said Liz. "That is fab!" they all said.
What can Zack do? "I can zig zag, roll, sniff tracks, and wag my tail," said Zack the pup. "That is a lot of tricks!" they all said.
What can you do?

questions.question: What tricks can Rex do?
Who can kick a ball into the net?
What does Pop say he can do?
What can Zack the pup do?
options: Sniff tracks and wag his tail
questions.answer: Sniff tracks and wag his tail

questions.question: What does Liz ride?

pages.text: Level 3 Book 6. Go Camping!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Pat and Sid are at camp. They have a small cabin and sit on a rug to snack.
Sid is a dog. Pat puts on a hat and gives one to Sid. "Let’s go swim," says Pat.
"Sid cannot swim," Pat says. "He will smell yuck," says Pat. "He can sit and rest."
Pat zips to the pond. He swims six laps. He flips, kicks, and spins back.
Sid sits on a mat. He is sad. He cannot swim like Pat.
Pat swims to Sid. "I will stop," Pat says. He jumps up to sit with Sid.
Pat slips on a plant. Sid drops in with a splash. Pat helps him up.
Back at the cabin, Pat dabs Sid with a rag. Sid smells bad but wags his tail.

questions.question: Where are Pat and Sid?
What does Pat do at the pond?
Why is Sid sad?
What happens when Pat slips on a plant?
options: Sid falls in with a splash
questions.answer: Sid falls in with a splash

questions.question: How does Sid feel at the end?

pages.text: Level 3 Book 7. Max and Min!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Max and Min went to the rocks to spot animals and pick snapdragons. They saw a rat and a wombat near the path.
They picked pink snapdragons and packed them in a red bag. "This is fun!" said Min. "Yes!" said Max.
Next day, Max went for a run. He stopped for a snack and a drink. He spotted bugs and flicked them off the mat.
Min was not with him. He did not run or snack or flick bugs. "What about me?" said Min. Min was sad.
So Min went to jump and flip on the hill. He did fun tricks and rolled on the grass.
Max was not with him. He did not jump or flip or roll. "What about me?" said Max. Max was sad.
Max and Min met by the tent. "Let’s have a picnic," said Max. Min gave a big nod.
They had buns, nuts, and cold drinks. They sat on a rug and smiled. "This is best!" they both said.

questions.question: What did Max and Min see near the path?
What did Max do the next day?
options: Went for a run and had a snack
Rolled on the grass with Min
questions.answer: Went for a run and had a snack

questions.question: Why was Min sad?
What did Max and Min do when they met by the tent?
What did they say at the end?

pages.text: Level 4 Book 1. Buzz and the Shell!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Buzz the bug sat on a log in the sun, watching the soft sand shimmer near the rocks.
He spotted a shiny shell tucked under a twig and zipped over with a big buzz.
Buzz tapped the shell with his leg - tap, tap! - and out came a sleepy crab.
The crab did not snap or scuttle away. Instead, it picked up a stick and made a trail in the sand.
Buzz followed the trail and hummed a happy tune as the wind rushed past.
The two new pals sat together on the shell and watched the waves crash and splash.
Buzz sipped from a tiny nut cup, and the crab munched on sea grass.
They rested in the sun, glad for the fun and their brand - new friendship.

questions.question: What animal is the main character?
What did the animal do?
Where did the story happen?
How did the animal feel?
What is the last thing the animal did?

pages.text: Level 4 Book 2. Chick in the Nest!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
High on a windy hill, a chick chirped in its nest, the leaves rustling all around.
The nest wobbled on a thick branch as the wind whooshed past with a strong push.
The little chick gave a loud 'chip! chip!' hoping someone would hear.
A duck heard the call and flapped up to the branch, wings wide, eyes bright.
It gently picked up the chick and glided down, landing on the soft moss below.
With care, the duck placed the chick in a new nest near a stump.
The chick fluffed its wings, blinked twice, and gave a happy chirp.
The wind was still, the nest was firm, and the chick curled up for a nap.

questions.question: What animal is the main character?
What did the animal do?
Where did the story happen?
How did the animal feel?
What is the last thing the animal did?

pages.text: Level 4 Book 3. The Fox and the Cliff!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
The fox dashed up the rocky path to the edge of a tall cliff, his paws light on the grass.
He stopped and sniffed the breeze - it was fresh and full of sea mist.
At the top, he spotted a red flag flapping on a post stuck between two rocks.
The fox crouched low, then jumped from stone to stone, tail straight for balance.
He dug his claws into the moss and climbed up with one big push.
He grabbed the flag with his teeth and gave a proud wag of his tail.
He raced back to his den, the flag waving behind like a bright badge.
Back home, the fox hung the flag and curled up on a rug, dreaming of his climb.

questions.question: What animal is the main character?
What did the animal do?
Where did the story happen?
How did the animal feel?
What is the last thing the animal did?

pages.text: Level 4 Book 4. Jazz the Fizz Bug!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
Jazz the fizz bug zipped over the pond, her wings buzzing like a tiny fan.
She spotted a red cup on a deck and landed for a sip of sweet drink.
The fizz popped and tickled her feet. She spun in a loop, dizzy with joy.
She darted to a windowsill where a bell rang out a soft ding - ding.
A cat slept on a mat just below, its tail flicking as it dreamed.
Jazz hovered above and then zipped past with a loop and a giggle.
She spun back to the deck, wings glinting in the sun, and took one last sip.
Jazz found a petal to nap on, curled up, and hummed a soft tune to sleep.

questions.question: What animal is the main character?
What did the animal do?
Where did the story happen?
How did the animal feel?
What is the last thing the animal did?

pages.text: Level 4 Book 5. The Puffin and the Fish!
From next page. Click word to hear them sound.
A puffin flapped in from the sea and landed with a skid on a ship 's wide deck.
He spotted a box with fresh fish, stacked near the net and ropes.
He pecked at the lid with his sharp beak until - thud! - the box tipped.
A silver fish flopped onto the wood, then slipped off the edge into the pond.
The puffin gave a quick squawk and jumped right in with a big splash.
He scooped the fish in his beak and paddled back with flaps and kicks.
Back on the deck, he dropped the fish and gobbled it up with glee.
The puffin sat on a coil of rope, full and glad, watching the waves roll in.
